column5: How is 502 up to Dryden this year? It was mentioned earlier but haven't seen any info since the fishing season began. Thanks.
It was fine!!!! So was 17 to the bay, and so was 105 to Ear Falls. ZERO construction for me last week!!

Very good. There were a couple of construction/one-lane bridges on the way to Sioux Lookout, but I don't remember which side of Dryden they were on. Both 502 and 72 were in very good shape with just the occasional, marked bump.
Both were between Dryden and Sioux Lookout.
Thanks. Now how about the drive up to St. Joe?
You can always check Ontario roads at:https://511on.ca/ Make sure the Incidents, Construction, and Current Roadwork boxes are checked. You can also check Future Roadwork box.

Besides the two construction/one-lane bridges, which were no problem, there were a few miscellaneous small potholes (usually right trailer tire from the edge) to watch for, but nothing major and overall, the road was in very good shape from Sioux Lookout to St. Joe.

Cool picture. Last year my bear hair raising experience was when we just crested a hill like the one in your photo. When we got to the top, a bear was leisurely walking across the opposing lane into our lane. By the time I locked it up and stopped, the bear had that same look......"What? You are in my space so shut up." We were close enough to see that the bear had just taken a bath in a lake as it was dripping wet. I think we saw 5 bears on the stretch of 17 we traveled over to Eagle Lake. PjShorthorn

The 502 is in the best condition I can remember. I drove it on the 13th and 20th. Zero issues. I don't remember any one lane construction zones either. There were a couple one lane zones with a stop light on 72 going to Sioux Lookout, but that was it.
